page.title: 19ECOLOGY_MARRAM GRASS.
page.content: MARRAM GRASS PLANTING{ {On Wednesday,May 21st,1985,Class3J {of Perranporth County Primary School, {went to plant marram grass with Mr. {David Lewis.He is one of the staff on {the County Conservation Service.First {he told us why we were planting it. { "We plant marram grass to bind the {sand as it is blown by the wind.This {helps the dunes to be formed again." {Mr.Lewis also told us that the roots {of the marram grass grow up to 100 {feet long. { Mr.Lewis said that when it is cold {the plant opens up to gather moisture {and when it is hot it closes up to {retain moisture.We planted the grass {to help preserve the dunes for future {generations.It all forms part of our {aim to care for the environment.} {
